# Individual Case Plots

## Wave 1

### NYC

```{r}
case_wave1_nyc <- df_wave %>%
  mutate(
    Y_i_hat_final = N(t_i, final)
  ) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = t_i)) + 
  geom_point(aes(y = Y_i), size = 1) +
  geom_line(aes(y = Y_i_hat_final, color = "red")) +
  labs(title = "New York City", x ="Days (since Feb 29, 2020)", y = "Cumulative cases") +
  theme(legend.position = "none")
```

# Grouped Case Plots 

## Wave 1 and Wave 2 Plots by Borough

### NYC

```{r}
ggarrange(case_wave1_nyc, case_wave2_nyc + ylab("") + ggtitle(""), 
          nrow = 1, ncol = 2, 
          common.legend = TRUE, legend = "bottom")
```

### Bronx

```{r}
ggarrange(case_wave1_bx, case_wave2_bx + ylab("") + ggtitle(""),
```
